title: KDE Neon Python Video Converter with GPU and Progress Bar
context: User developed a Python helper script on KDE Neon to batch convert MP4 files into WebM format using ffmpeg, with GPU acceleration and a real-time progress bar.
keyIdea: Automate MP4-to-WebM conversion using ffmpeg with dynamic bitrate, GPU acceleration (VAAPI/NVENC), and visual progress reporting via rich library.
commands:
sudo apt install ffmpeg python3-pip
pip install rich tqdm
python3 webmshrink.py --target 50 --gpu
explanation: This helper script automates the conversion of large MP4 videos into smaller WebM files. It calculates optimal bitrates for target size, supports hardware acceleration, and provides visual feedback through a progress bar. The script monitors ffmpeg's stderr output for timestamps to report progress accurately.

reusabilityNotes.whenToReuse: Whenever you need an automated and GPU-accelerated video compression pipeline on a Linux system using ffmpeg.
reusabilityNotes.pitfalls: Ensure ffmpeg supports the desired hardware encoders (vaapi/nvenc) and verify driver installation; incorrect buffer sizes or missing encoders can cause truncated output.
